Text:
You're welcome.
I though there was something uniquely Dr. Demento-ish and more specifically Zappa-ish about this.

Zappa's work had quite a range to it; this illustrated a few components of that but is still only a small piece.

Especially in retrospect, Zappa does seem like the type of musician who would give The Beatles ironic treatment.
(I myself had thought of something kinda  similar with a particular Beatles-related remix/mashup idea)

Of course Frank would fry the Beatles, the (then) ultimate product placement band, rich, happy, and taking all the credit, where Frank and the gang are stuck in a hole in the wall, composing masterpieces but seen as a (collective) dirty-winged Icarus, you feel me?

Yeah, Zappa was one of those classic artists who didn't get the respect he deserved. 
So, angst at the mainstream (even really good mainstream like The Beatles) is somewhat understandable.
